rationale: Development of application systems and software that use underlying architecture of machines efficiently and effectively requires the ability to use and manipulate various types of Data Structures and other constructs. This being a fundamental ability which is language neutral yet requires use of a language for its implementation. This is a basic course which goes along with other programming courses to develop an integrated ability to efficient software development, hence this course is very important for computer engineers.
competency: Implement various types of Data Structures algorithms using Python.

courseOutcomes.description: Comprehend the basic concepts of data structures, analysis terms, OOPs concepts, and recursive functions.
Apply basic operations on stack, queue and linked list data structures.
Apply basic operations on linked list data structure.
Apply different sorting and searching algorithms to the small data sets.
Illustrate algorithms to insert, delete and searching a node in tree.

underpinningTheory.title: Basic Concepts of Data Structures & OOP
unitOutcomes: Define linear and non-linear data structures
Define time complexity and space complexity
Explain concepts of Object Oriented programming
Explain the concept of class and object
Explain the concept of constructors and how they are used to initialize objects
Describe the Operations on arrays
Differentiate Array and List
topics: 1.3 Analysis Terms (for the definitions purpose only): Time Complexity, Space Complexity, Asymptotic Notations, Big 'O', Notation, Best case Time Complexity, Average case Time Complexity, Worst case Time Complexity
1.7 Types of methods: Instance method, Class method, static method

underpinningTheory.title: Stack and Queues
unitOutcomes: Implement Stack Operations using List
List applications of Stack
Convert the given expression from Infix to Prefix/Postfix using stack
Evaluate the postfix expression using stack
Implement Queue Operations using List
Explain concepts of Circular queue
List applications of Queue
Differentiate circular and simple queues
topics: 2.4 Application of Stack - Infix, Prefix and Postfix Forms of Expressions, Evaluations of postfix expression, Recursive Functions (Factorial, Fibonacci series)
2.6 Operations on Queue - Enqueue and Dequeue
2.11 Differentiate circular queue and simple queue

underpinningTheory.title: Linked List
unitOutcomes: Define a linked list
List types of Linked List
Implement basic operations on singly linked lists
Explain concepts of circular linked lists
Differentiate between circular linked list and singly linked list
Explain concepts of doubly linked lists
List applications of Linked List
topics: 3.3 Basic operations on singly linked list: Insertion of a new node in the beginning of the list, at the end of the list, after a given node, before a given node, Deleting the first and last node from a linked list, Count the number of nodes in linked list
3.5 Difference between circular linked list and singly linked list

underpinningTheory.title: Searching and Sorting
unitOutcomes: Design and Implement search algorithms
Arrange data in ascending and descending orders using appropriate sorting algorithms
Explain the working of the given sorting method step-by-step with An example and small data set
topics: 4.1 Searching an element into List: Linear Search, Binary Search
4.2 Sorting Methods: Bubble Sort, Selection Sort, Quick Sort, Insertion Sort, Merge Sort

underpinningTheory.title: Trees
unitOutcomes: Describe a binary tree
Draw binary search tree for the given data set
Write algorithms to traverse the tree using the given method
List applications of trees
topics: 5.1 Binary trees: Complete Binary Tree, Basic Terms: level number, degree, in-degree and out-degree, leaf node
5.2 Binary Search Tree: Insertion of a node in binary tree, Deletion of a node in binary tree, Searching a node in binary tree

practicalExercises.description: Design an student class for reading and displaying the student information, the getInfo() and displayInfo() methods will be used respectively. Where getInfo() will be a private method.
Design a class Complex for adding the two complex numbers and show the use of constructor.

Write Python class to represent a bank account. The class contains account holder name, account number, type of account and balance amount as the data members. The member functions are as follows: to initialize the data members, to deposit an amount, to withdraw an amount after checking balance, and to display name and balance.

Write Python class to represent a Cricketer. The class contains name of cricketer, team name and run as the data members. The member functions are as follows: to initialize the data members, to set run and display run.
Implement push and pop algorithms of stack using list.
Implement a program to convert infix notation to postfix notation using stack.
Implement a program to implement queue using list that performs following operations: enqueue, dequeue, display

Implement program to perform following operation on singly linked list: a. Insert a node at the beginning of a singly linked list. b. Insert a node at the end of a singly linked list. c. Insert a node after the given node of a singly linked list. d. Insert a node before the given node of singly linked list. e. Delete a node from the beginning of a singly linked list. f. Delete a node from the end of a singly linked list. g. Count the number of nodes of a singly linked list. h. Display content of singly linked list
Implement program to create and display circular linked list.
Implement program to perform following operation on doubly linked list: traversal, searching, adding and removing node.
Implement a python program to search a particular element from list using Linear and Binary Search.
Implement Selection sort and Insertion sort algorithm.
Implement construction of binary search trees.

Write a menu driven program to perform following operation on Binary Search Tree: a. Create a BST. b. Insert an element in BST. c. Pre-order traversal of BST. d. In-order traversal of BST. e. Post-order traversal of BST. f. Delete an element from BST

suggestedMicroProjects: Develop a Python Program that evaluate the given arithmetic expression using stack.
Develop a Python Program that maintain a queue of persons. In this queue user can add a person, delete a person and search a person.
Develop a Python Program that perform banking operations like withdraw cash, deposit cash and mini statement using appropriate data structure.
Develop a Python Program for process management algorithm by using appropriate data structure.
Develop a Python Program for print spooler using appropriate Data structure.
Develop a Python Program for Telephone Directory system. In this user can adding, searching, modifying, listing, and deleting records through the use of appropriate data structure.

Phone directory application using doubly-linked lists- This project can demonstrate the working of contact book applications and also teach you about data structures like arrays, linked lists, stacks, and queues. Typically, phone book management encompasses searching, sorting, and deleting operations. A distinctive feature of the search queries here is that the user sees suggestions from the contact list after entering each character.

Hangman Game: The Hangman program randomly selects a secret word from a list of secret words. A random word (E.g. a fruit name) is picked up from our collection and the player gets limited chances to win the game. When a letter in that word is guessed correctly, that letter position in the word is made visible. In this way, all letters of the word are to be guessed before all the chances are over.
Stack and queue implementation using linked list: Develop a python program that implements stack and queue operations using linked list representation.

learningResources.title: Data structures and algorithms in python
learningResources.author: Goodrich

learningResources.title: An Introduction to Data Structures with Applications
learningResources.author: Jean-Paul Tremblay & Paul G. Sorenson

learningResources.title: Data Structures and Algorithms using Python
learningResources.author: Rance D. Necaise

equipmentRequired.equipment: Computer system with operating system: Windows 7 or higher Ver., macOS, and Linux, with 4GB or higher RAM, Python versions: 2.7.X, 3.6.X or higher
Python IDEs and Code Editors Open Source: IDLE, Jupyter, Spyder (Anaconda)

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member
Practice environment friendly methods and processes
studentActivities: Provide students with code snippets and ask them to identify the Big O notation for each one.
https://code.org/, an hour of code may be organized and students are encouraged to participate
Students are encouraged to register themselves in various MOOCs such as: Swayam, edx, Coursera, Udemy etc. to further enhance their learning.
List the applications which are developed using Python data structures
Encourage students to participate in different coding competitions like hackathon, online competitions on code chef etc.
Encourage students to form a coding club at institute level and can help the slow learners.
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/sub topics.
Diagnosing Essential Missed Learning concepts that will help for students.
Guide Students to do Personalized learning so that students can understand the course material at his or her pace.
Encourage students to do Group learning by sharing so that teaching can easily be enhanced.
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes.
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods.
With respect to section No.10, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities.
Guide students on how to address issues on environment and sustainability using the knowledge of this course

performanceIndicators.indicator: Correctness of program & approach to implement logic
Readability and documentation of the program/Quality of input and output displayed (messaging and formatting)
Use python concepts to implement efficient program

specificationTable.title: Basic Concepts of Data Structures & OOP

poCompetencyMapping.courseOutcome: CO a) Comprehend the basic concepts of data structures, analysis terms, OOPs concepts, and recursive functions
CO b) Apply basic operations on stack, queue data structures
CO c) Apply basic operations on linked list data structures
CO d) Apply different sorting and searching algorithms to the small data sets
CO e) Illustrate algorithms to insert, delete and searching a node in tree
